name: Digoxin

indications.text: adults , digoxin indicated treatment mild moderate heart failure control resting ventricular rate patients chronic atrial fibrillation . ( 1 ) pediatric patients heart failure , digoxin increases myocardial contractility .

contraindications.text: toxic levels digoxin slightly higher therapeutic levels . pharmacokinetics digoxin complex dose determination take account patient-specific factors ( age , lean body weight , renal function , etc . ) . ( 2.4 ) ( 2.5 ) patients monitored toxicity therapeutic effect doses adjusted , accordingly . ( 2.2 )

adverseReactions: allergy digoxin rare . digoxin contraindicated patients known hypersensitivity digoxin forms digitalis . digitalis glycosides , digoxin , contraindicated ventricular fibrillation .
indications_original: In adults, digoxin is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate heart failure and for the control of resting ventricular rate in patients with chronic atrial fibrillation. (1) In pediatric patients with heart failure, digoxin increases myocardial contractility.
contraindications_original: Toxic levels of digoxin are only slightly higher than therapeutic levels. The pharmacokinetics of digoxin are complex and dose determination should take into account patient-specific factors (age, lean body weight, renal function, etc.). (2.4)(2.5) Patients should be monitored for toxicity and therapeutic effect and doses should be adjusted, accordingly. (2.2)
adverseReactions_original: Allergy to digoxin is rare. Digoxin is contraindicated in patients with a known hypersensitivity to digoxin or other forms of digitalis. Digitalis glycosides, such as digoxin, are contraindicated in ventricular fibrillation.
